controls.control: The physical security manager must review these reports weekly.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that the physical security manager is reviewing reports weekly.

controls.control: The access-control system audit trail must be maintained for at least three months.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of reports to verify the access-control system audit trail is maintained for at least three months.
Examine access-control system setting to verify that audit trails are enabled and are kept for three months.

controls.control: System Administration
Each access-control system administrator uses his or her own user ID and password.

testingProcedures.description: Examine access-control system documentation to validate each access-control system administrator uses his or her own user ID and password.
Interview personnel to verify that each access-control system administrator uses his or her own user ID and password.

controls.control: Passwords are changed at least every 90 days.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify procedures are in place that passwords are changed at least every 90 days.
Examine a sample of system configurations to verify passwords required to be changed at least every 90 days.
Interview personnel to verify that passwords are changed at least every 90 days.

controls.control: User IDs and passwords are assigned to the physical security manager and authorized personnel, who must be employees.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of logs to verify user IDs and passwords are assigned to the physical security manager and authorized personnel.
Examine documentation to verify that user IDs and passwords are assigned to the physical security manager and authorized personnel
Interview personnel to verify that access-control system administrators are vendor employees.

controls.control: The physical security manager and other authorized personnel (who must be employees) are the only individuals able to modify the access-control system controls. All changes to the system must be logged.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify that the physical security manager and other authorized personnel (who must be employees) are the only individuals able to modify the access-control system controls and that all changes to the system are logged.
Examine a sample of logs to verify the physical security manager and other authorized personnel are the only individuals who modified the access-control system controls.

controls.control: At the end of each session, the individual who initiated the session must log off the system.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify at the end of each session, the individual who initiated the session is the one who must log off the system.

controls.control: All changes to card production, provisioning, and security-relevant systems are recorded and reviewed monthly by a senior manager who is not the individual initially involved in changing the system.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of change-management documents to verify that all changes to card production, provisioning, and security-relevant systems are recorded and reviewed monthly by a senior manager who is not the individual initially involved in changing the system.

controls.control: Activation

When a duress button is activated, a warning or emergency signal must be sent to an on-site security control room, a remote central monitoring station, or the local police station. The anticipated initial response—i.e., event verification—must be within two minutes.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of past events or of testing documentation to demonstrate when a duress button is activated the following occurs but not limited to:

  • A warning or emergency signal is sent to an on-site security control room.

  • A remote central monitoring station, or the local police station.

  • The anticipated initial response—i.e., event verification—is within two minutes.

controls.control:
All details relating to the activation of the duress button and the response by the remote central monitoring service or the local police must be recorded in the control log, including the following:

  • Time and date when the duress button was activated

  • Time taken by the remote central monitoring service to respond

  • Time taken by the police or other help to respond/arrive on site

  • Chronology of all related activities, including names of personnel involved

  • Reason for activating alarm

testingProcedures.description:

  • Time taken by the remote central monitoring service to respond

  • Time taken by the police or other help to respond/arrive on site

  • Reason for activating alarm

Examine that procedures are in place related to the activation of the duress button to require that the response by the remote central monitoring service or the local police be recorded in the control log.

controls.control: Testing

  • Date and time the key is returned (transfer of responsibility)

  • Name and signature of the card production staff member receiving the key

testingProcedures.description:

controls.control: Monitor, Camera, and Digital Recorder Requirements

Each monitor, camera, and digital recorder must function properly and produce clear images on the monitors without being out-of-focus, blurred, washed out, or excessively darkened. The equipment must record at a minimum of four frames per second.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine each monitor, camera, and digital recorder settings and documentation to verify that camera recordings provide the following at a minimum:

  • Four (4) picture frames per second on motion or four (4) picture frames per second permanently; and

  • Clear images on the monitor without being out-of-focus, blurred, washed out, or excessively darkened.

controls.control: CCTV cameras must record all activity, including recording events during dark periods through the use of infrared CCTV cameras or automatic activation of floodlights in case of any detected activity. This recording may be via motion activation. The recording must capture any motion at least five seconds before and after the detected motion.

testingProcedures.description: Examine CCTV camera settings and documentation to verify that camera recordings—e.g., via motion activation—provide a minimum of the requirements listed below.

Observe a demonstration (including dark periods) to verify the CCTV that camera recordings—e.g., via motion activation—provide a minimum of:

  • Recording to capture any motion at least five seconds before and after the detected motion.

  • Recording all activity, including events during dark periods through the use of infrared CCTV cameras or automatic activation of floodlights in case of any detected activity.

controls.control: CCTV monitors and recorders must be located in an area that is restricted from unauthorized personnel.

testingProcedures.description: Observe that CCTV monitors and recorders are in a location restricted from unauthorized personnel.

controls.control:
CCTV cameras must be connected at all times to:

  • Monitors located in the control room

  • An alarm system that will generate an alarm if the CCTV is disrupted

  • An active image-recording device

testingProcedures.description:
Observe that CCTV cameras are connected (via a list of known cameras) and active at all times to but not limited to:

  • Monitors located in the control room

  • An alarm system that will generate an alarm if the CCTV is disrupted

  • An active image-recording device

controls.control: View Requirements
Each camera view must include all activities necessary to provide adequate security coverage. Blind spots must not exist.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a sample of CCTV cameras media to verify camera footage captures all activities to provide adequate security coverage and that there are no blind spots.

controls.control: The recording must capture sufficient images to identify the individual— e.g., head and shoulder’s view—as well as the activity being performed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine sample of recording to verify that it captured sufficient images to identify the individual—e.g., head and shoulder’s view—as well as any activity being performed.

controls.control: Each internal CCTV camera and recording system must be equipped with an automatic recording capability in case of an alarm event.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of video recordings or live video to verify internal CCTV cameras recording system have been equipped with an automatic recording capability when an alarm event occurs.

controls.control: Retention of Video Recordings
CCTV images must be kept for at least 90 days and must be backed up daily. Both primary and backup copies must exist for a minimum of 90 days.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documentation and a sample of archived video to verify CCTV images are:

  • Kept for at least 90 days;

  • Backed up daily; and that

  • Both primary and backup copies exist for a minimum of 90 days.

controls.control: The backup recording or mirror image must be stored in a separate, secure location within the facility and must ensure segregation of duties between the users and administrators of the system. Backups may also be stored in other approved facilities of the card vendor via techniques such as disk mirroring, provided the storage is secure in accordance with these requirements. An approved facility is one evaluated as compliant to these requirements and is participating in the applicable card brand program.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that segregation of duties exists between the users and the system administrators.

Observe to verify that backup recordings are stored in a separate, secured location within the facility or stored in other facilities via techniques such as disk mirroring in accordance with the retention policy requirements.
Examine documentation to verify backup recording and storage requirements exist.

  • Access-control system

  • Window and door contacts

  • Glass-break detectors

  • Emergency door alarms

  • Passive infrared detectors

  • Microwave sensors

  • CCTV monitors

Examine documentation to verify the vendor has a written contingency plan to guarantee that security for card components, products, and data are maintained in case of critical business interruption.

controls.control: The vendor must inventory the films, printing plates, and duplicates including a record of plates issued from and returned to the printing department.

testingProcedures.description: Interview printing department staff to verify how often, by whom, and what documentation is in place regarding the inventory of films, printing plates, and duplicates issued and returned to the printing department.

controls.control: The vendor must audit this inventory quarterly.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify the vendor conducts audits on a quarterly basis.

controls.control: The vendor must keep films and printing plates locked under dual control when not in use.

testingProcedures.description: Observe security controls in place for films and printing plates and verify there are dual-control storage requirements when films and printing plates are not in use.

controls.control: Materials maintained must be limited to the final approved version of the last production run of a particular card type.

testingProcedures.description: Examine what materials are in place within the production area.
Observe production staff and verify what procedures are in place to ensure proper levels of materials are maintained on hand for the last production runs of particular card types.

controls.control: All discrepancies must be documented and immediately reported to management. Any loss or theft of materials must be reported to the VPA within 24 hours of discovery.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation and verify security controls are in place such that all discrepancies are documented and immediately reported to management.
Examine a sample of documentation to verify that any loss or theft is reported to the VPA within 24 hours of discovery.

Core Sheets
Access

testingProcedures.description: Observe the material/production regimen for allocation of core sheets for production runs to verify existence.

When partially or fully printed sheets are stored outside the vault for more than one week, they must be stored in a work-in-progress (WIP) storage room.

Observe storage controls in place by vendor for both partially and fully printed sheets.

  • Rejected sheets

  • Quality control sheets

  • Unused core sheets

controls.control: Sheets printed with the payment system brand or issuer design must not be used as set-up sheets unless clearly marked void over the payment-system brand/issuer design.

testingProcedures.description: Examine procedures for use of the WIP area to verify that partially finished cards are stored properly in the HSA.
Observe to verify cards stored outside the vault are stored in secure, locked containers in the HSA under dual controls.

controls.control: Ordering Proprietary Components
The vendor must obtain proprietary components—e.g., signature panels, holographic materials, special dies—only from authorized suppliers.

controls.control: The vendor must provide the supplier with both the street and mailing addresses of the vendor’s facility, as well as names and signatures of the vendor’s authorized representatives that will be ordering components.

controls.control: Audit Controls − Production
General
controls.description: An order may be separated into multiple jobs, which may be split into different batches.

If modifications are to be made to the audit log, a single line must be made through the original figure.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of audit logs to verify that all modifications to the audit logs are being made in the authorized and designated manner.

controls.control: The updated figure and the initials of the card production staff member making the changes must be placed adjacent to the incorrect figure.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of logs to verify that all modifications to the audit log are being made in the authorized and designated manner.

controls.control: Log Review
All logs must be reviewed and validated for completeness at least weekly by an individual who is not involved in the direct operation of the equipment.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of logs to verify that they are being reviewed and validated for accuracy at least weekly by an individual not involved in the direct operation of the equipment.

controls.control: The review must be signed and dated as part of the log.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of logs and verify that it is signed and dated as required and by the proper individual.

controls.control: All logs referenced in this document must be retained for a minimum of two years unless otherwise stated.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of logs and verify that logs are retained for a minimum of two years unless required otherwise.

controls.control: The vendor must apply audit controls to each job/batch received, whereby an effective audit trail is established for each production step.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a complete job run to verify procedures are followed.
Examine policies/procedures to verify audit controls and an audit trail are in place for each job/batch and production step.

controls.control: All card products and components—both good and rejected, including samples—must be counted and reconciled prior to any transfer of responsibility.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a sample production job/run and validate that all card products and components—both good and rejected, including samples—are counted and reconciled prior to any transfer of responsibility.

controls.control:
An effective audit trail is comprised of a series of audit logs that must contain but are not limited to the following information:

  • Description of the component or card product(s) being transferred

  • Name and signature of the individual releasing the component or card product(s)

  • Name and signature of the individual receiving the component or card product(s)

Examine a sample of audit logs used during a production runs to verify that they contain:

  • Name and signature of the individual receiving the component or card product(s)

  • Number of components used

  • Number returned to vault or WIP storage

  • Number rejected or damaged

  • Number to be destroyed

  • Date and time of transfer

  • Signatures of persons inventorying components

controls.control: At the end of each production step, two persons must simultaneously count the card components and related components and sign the audit control documents.

testingProcedures.description: Observe production run to verify the security controls in place include a dual count of cards after each step of the production run.

controls.control: Audit control documents must be completed and reconciled at the end of each production step and when changing shifts. They must be attached to or included with the work in process.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of audit control documentation to verify it is completed and reconciled at the end of each production step and when changing shifts.
Observe a sample production run to witness reconciliation of audit-control documents and that they are attached to or included with the work in process.

controls.control: The vendor must be able to confirm that the material, including waste, used in the manufacture of card products matches the amount of material indicated in the inventory control logs. The audit trail must be kept for at least 24 months. This information must be available for inspection.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of documentation to verify:

  • Accurate and complete inventory of materials is completed.

  • Audit trails of the past 24 months are maintained by the vendor and available for inspection.

controls.control: The vendor must maintain an original or a copy of both the purchase order and invoice for procured materials to serve as an audit control log.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify that originals or copies of both the purchase order and invoice for procured materials are being maintained.

controls.control: The vendor must conduct inventory counts to ensure that invoices are correct and that they comply with the purchase order.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of inventory counts to verify accuracy of the invoices related to the purchase orders.

controls.control: During the processing of card products (encoding, embossing, and personalizing), only the minimum number of boxes or sleeves required may be opened at one time. The contents of partially used boxes or sleeves must be verified against the inventory control documents. Before additional boxes or sleeves are opened, any partially used boxes or sleeves must be fully used. The number of cards in partially used boxes and sleeves must be verified, and each box or sleeve must be rewrapped and sealed before being stored in the vault.

testingProcedures.description:
Observe the processing of card products to verify that:

  • The process includes only the minimum number of boxes or sleeves required be opened at one time.

  • The contents of partially used boxes or sleeves are verified against the inventory control documents.

  • Any partially used boxes or sleeves are fully used before additional boxes or sleeves are opened

  • The number of cards in partially used boxes and sleeves are verified.

  • Each box or sleeve is rewrapped and sealed before being stored in the vault

controls.control: Card components must be received and initially inventoried against the supplier’s shipping documentation under dual control.

testingProcedures.description: Observe or review a sample of card components received to verify they are inventoried under dual control against the supplier’s shipping documentation for accuracy.

controls.control: A physical count of the boxes containing the card components must be completed at delivery to confirm accuracy of the shipper’s documents.

testingProcedures.description: Observe or review a delivery sample to verify that there is a physical count of the boxes containing the card components and that it matches the shipper’s documents.

controls.control: An authorized card production staff member must sign for all component stock received by the vendor. The person delivering the stock must also sign the transfer document.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of transfer documentation to validate:

  • An authorized card production staff member signs for the component stock received by the vendor.

  • The person delivering the stock also signs the transfer documentation.

controls.control: Card components must be transferred to the vault immediately.

testingProcedures.description: Observe or review the process in place to verify immediate storage of card components into the vault.

controls.control: The exact quantity of card components must be counted and registered in the inventory book before vault storage.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the inventory book to verify accurate counts of card components are being maintained by vendor.

controls.control: In the case of holograms, the hologram identification number to be registered as initial stock inventory must be the first good hologram image on the reel (this may be different from the number of holograms indicated in the delivery note).

testingProcedures.description:
Examine the inventory book to validate that:

  • The hologram identification number is being registered and listed.

  • If new reels are present, the first hologram number has been listed and matches the reel stored in the vault.

controls.control:
The card component inventory log must include but is not limited to:

testingProcedures.description:

  • Customer job number

  • Number of images or modules placed on cards

  • Number of rejected images or modules from header and trailer scrap

  • Number of and reason for rejected images

controls.control: Card components must be removed from the machine and locked within a secure container when not in use.

Examine policies/procedures to verify that card components are removed from the machine and locked within a secure container when not in use.

controls.control: Card components must be returned to the vault during non-production hours.

testingProcedures.description: Observe and verify that card components are returned to the vault during non-production hours.
Examine policies/procedures to verify that card components are returned to the vault during non- production hours.

controls.control: Rejected card components awaiting return for credits must be maintained under dual control.

testingProcedures.description: Observe and verify that rejected cards awaiting return for credits are maintained under dual control.

controls.control: Vault Audit Controls

A log is required for items moved in or out of the vault and must contain:

  • Type of card

  • Number of cards returned to inventory

testingProcedures.description:
Examine the vault log to verify that at a minimum it contains:

  • Name of the card issuer

  • Type of card

  • Number of cards originally placed in inventory

  • Reason for transaction—e.g., job number

  • Number of cards removed from inventory

  • Number of cards returned to inventory

  • Balance remaining in the vault

  • Date and time of activity

  • Names and signatures of the card production staff who handled the transaction
Observe items being logged in and out of the vault to verify that proper documentation is accurately completed.

controls.control: Two card production staff must create a written, physical inventory of card and card components monthly.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of monthly inventory to verify that an inventory of cards and card components is being completed on a monthly basis by two card production staff.

controls.control: Card production staff performing the inventory must not have knowledge of the results of the last inventory.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify controls are in place to restrict knowledge of any previous inventory.

controls.control:

  • Name and signature of both card production staff who conducted the inventory

testingProcedures.description:

  • Date of the review

  • Name of the card issuer

  • Type of card

  • Number of cards indicated in the inventory

  • Number of cards counted

  • Name and signature of both card production staff who conducted the inventory

controls.control: Any discrepancies must be reported to management and resolved.

testingProcedures.description: Examine procedures related to discrepancies to verify they are reported to management for resolution.

controls.control: Personalization Audit Controls
During personalization, cards and cardholder data must be handled in a secure manner to ensure accountability.

testingProcedures.description: Observe personalization process and validate controls are in place that ensure a secure method of handling and accountability.

controls.control:
An audit control log must be maintained for each job/sub-job (batch) designating:

  • Job number

  • Issuer name

  • Card type

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of audit control logs to verify they include job number, issuer name, and card type.

controls.control:
For each personalization batch, include:

  • Initial card procurement (beginning balance)

  • Card re-makes

  • Cards returned to inventory

  • Spoiled cards

  • Sample/test cards

  • Machine/operation identification

testingProcedures.description:

  • Machine/operation identification

  • Date and time of reconciliation

  • Operator name and signature

  • Name and signature of an individual other than the operator, who is responsible for verifying the count

controls.control:
For accounts/envelopes, include:

  • Name and signature of an individual other than the operator, who is responsible for verifying the count

  • Name and signature of an individual other than the operator, who is responsible for verifying the count

controls.control: Indent Printing Module
Use payment system proprietary typefaces within indent-printing modules only for payment system cards

controls.control: Destroy, under dual control, payment system proprietary typefaces within indent-printing modules that are no longer to be used.

testingProcedures.description: Examine polices/procedures to verify they exist to destroy, under dual control, payment system proprietary typefaces within indent-printing modules that are no longer to be used.

controls.control: Record the destruction of modules.

controls.control: Tipping Foil

The vendor must shred completely used tipping foil reels containing cardholder data as follows:

  • In-house⎯i.e., within the facility,

  • The destruction can occur as frequently as the vendor deems necessary but—in all cases—weekly at a minimum. The vendor must maintain proper controls over these materials at all times prior to destruction, and the destruction must occur within the HSA.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of destruction logs to verify that destruction is occurring at a minimum on a weekly basis, in house, under dual control, and within the HSA.

Observe procedure of removal of tipping foil to verify it is followed by vendor.

controls.control: Prior to destruction—e.g., shredding—the foil must be stored within the HSA under dual access control.

testingProcedures.description: Observe security controls are in place to store tipping foil under dual control within the HSA prior to shredding.

controls.control: When destroyed the results must be non-readable and non-recoverable.

controls.control: An inventory of the number of used reels must be maintained and reconciled with the number of reels shredded.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documentation to verify logs are maintained for the destruction of the foil and they contain at a minimum:

  • Number of reels—partial or full. All used foil must be accounted for and destroyed.

  • Date and time

  • Written initials of both individuals who witnessed the destruction

controls.description: Note: The following requirements apply ONLY to thermal transfer foil reels/cassettes used within a production environment to apply cardholder data—e.g., those used in personalization or PIN printing processes.

controls.control: Prior to destruction—e.g., shredding—the foil must be stored within the HSA under dual access control.

testingProcedures.description: Observe security controls are in place to store thermal transfer foil under dual control within the HSA prior to destruction.

controls.control: When destroyed the results must be non-readable and non-recoverable.

controls.control: An inventory of the number of used reels and/or cassettes must be maintained and reconciled with the number of used reels and/or cassettes destroyed.

controls.control:

controls.control: Returned Cards/PIN Mailers

controls.control: Delivery
Card Mailing
Emergency Cards and PINs

Vendors may include the PIN with the mailing of emergency cards only with written approval from the issuer. Card vendors will be responsible for ensuring an appropriate officer of the card issuer has signed the authorization letter and that a copy of the letter is maintained in their files. The authorization letter must acknowledge that the issuer accepts all risk inherent in shipping cards and PINs together and must confirm that the expedited process is permitted only for emergency card replacement orders. Issuers may provide the card vendor with a standing letter of instruction and do not need to approve each emergency card replacement order.

Such letters contain acknowledgment from the issuer accepting all risk inherent in shipping cards and PINs together;

Such letters confirm that the expedited process is permitted only for emergency card replacement orders; and

The issuer may issue a standing letter of instruction and does not need to approve each emergency card replacement order.

controls.control:
